description:
These authentic rice noodles are essential to Thai cooking. Prepare them with chicken, beef, seafood or vegetables. For extra flavor combine with your favorite Thai sauce. Enjoy! In Soups and Stews, use leftover noodles in your favorite soups and stews. Just add prior to serving. Warm through. Enjoy!

Directions:

Stir-Fry or Sauté:
1. Pour noodles into a bowl. 2. Cover with very hot tap water. Stir to separate. Soak noodles for 25-30 minutes. Do not over soak. 3. Drain noodles. 4. Stir-fry noodles with your favorite ingredients until firm yet tender (al dente) and heated through, about 4-6 minutes. Enjoy!

As Pasta:
1. Add noodles to 4 quarts salted boiling water. Stir to separate, boil until tender yet still firm (al dente), about 4-6 minutes. 2. Immediately drain cooked noodles. Quickly rinse under cold water and drain again. 3. Add your favorite sauce. Serve immediately.
title: A Taste of Thai Straight Cut Rice Noodles 16 oz

description:
Lotus Foods brings you Jade Pearl Rice Ramen, traditional Japanese-style noodles made from our specialty rice instead of wheat! Add the savory white miso broth to our quick-cook Jade Pearl Rice Ramen for a convenient bowl of flavorful and nourishing noodle soup any time. For a complete meal, add your favorite veggies and protein.

Directions
Place 2 cups of water in a pot and bring to a boil. Add ramen and simmer gently for 4 minutes, stirring occasionally. When the noodles are just soft, remove from heat and mix in contents of the enclosed soup packet.

description:
Versatile, easy to cook and delicious with any sauce, rice noodles add that memorable Thai touch to any meal. With Thai Kitchen Stir-Fry Rice Noodles, you can now make authentic restaurant-style Thai dishes such as Pad Thai or steaming bowls of rice noodle soup.

Directions
Bring large pot of water to boil. Remove from heat. Add Thai Kitchen Stir-Fry Rice Noodles; let stand 8 to 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Soak until noodles are soft but firm. Drain well and immediately toss with your favorite sauce, dressing, Thai curry, or add to your favorite soup just before serving.

Tip: If you do not use noodles immediately after softening, cover noodles with plastic wrap or let stand soaking in cold water until ready to use. If noodles become sticky, simply rinse gently with warm water to separate.
title: Thai Kitchen Stir-fry Rice Noodles 14 oz

description:
Unique brown rice noodles get their warm color from naturally brown rice. Their mild flavor and tender texture make them versatile for all types of dishes - from noodle stir-fries and steaming bowls of rice noodle soups to cold noodle salads.

Directions
Cooking: Bring large pot of water to boil. Remove from heat. Add desired amount of noodles, stirring to separate noodles. Let stand 5 minutes or until noodles are tender but firm. Drain noodles in colander. Rinse with cold water, if desired. Use immediately. Tip: If not using immediately, let cooked noodles stand in bowl of cold water to prevent noodles from sticking. Just before using, drain noodles.

description:
Keep it tasty, simple and satisfying. Serve with steamed rice.

Recipe Guide: Simply Add: 2 tbsp canola or vegetable oil; 1 lb thinly sliced boneless chicken breast or thighs, pork fillet or whole peeled shrimp; 1 egg, lightly beaten; 4 scallions, white and green parts finely sliced; juice of 1 lemon.

Directions
Step 1: Place Rice Stick Noodles in a large heat-safe bowl and cover with boiling water. Use a fork to stir and separate noodles. Leave to soak for 5-10 minutes or until softened. Drain noodles and rinse with cold water. Set aside for later. Step 2: In a large skillet or wok, heat oil over high heat. Add meat or shrimp and cook for 2-5 minutes or until cooked through. Push everything to one side of the pan or wok and add egg to the empty side. Let egg set for a minute until it starts to firm up. Now break up the egg and mix it through the meat/shrimp. Add softened rice stick noodles and Pad Thai Sauce into the pan. Use tongs to mix the whole lot together until well combined. Remove from heat and toss in the scallions and lemon juice. Enjoy! Marion's Meal Idea: Serve my Pad Thai as part of a traditional Thai banquet for 4, along with other dishes such as a curry, stir fry and/or Thai salad.
title: Marion's Kitchen Pad Thai 15.2-oz.

description:
Directions
1. Place noodles in bowl after removing from package. 2. Add enough hot water to cover the noodles. Wait for 2 minutes with lid closed. 3. Loosen the noodles slightly. Carefully drain water through the holes with lid closed. 4. Add soup base and flakes. Pour hot water up to the inside line. Close the lid. 5. Wait for 1 minute and serve. For More Convenience: 1. Place all contents in bowl after removing packages. 2. Add hot water up to the inside line. Wait 2 minutes with lid. 5. Wait for 1 minute and serve.
title: Nong Shim Saeng Udon Bowl - 9.73 oz

description:
Directions

Microwave (1000 W):
1. Open lid half way. Add soup base. 2. Pour room temperature water up to the inside line. 3. Microwave for 3 minutes. 4. Leave product in the microwave for 1 minute to cool. Stir well and serve.

Cooking (Hot Water):
1. Open lid half way. Add soup base. 2. Pour hot water up to the inside line. 3. Close lid for 3 minutes stir well and serve. Caution: Product is very hot after heating. Handle with care to avoid spilling or burning yourself.
title: Nong Shim Shin Noodle Bowl - 3oz

description:
Directions
1. Pull back lid to dotted line. Remove all four flavor packets from noodle tray. Add enough boiling water to noodles to reach inside line. 2. Close lid, wait 3 minutes. 3. Peel off drain spout slowly. 4. Slowly drain water from tray through the holes. 5. Remove lid. Add sauce, mustard mayonnaise and spice packets. Mix well and serve! Detail cooking directions and illustrations are shown on the lid.
title: Myojo Yakisoba Noodles 4.77 oz

Directions

description:
Dynasty Sesame oil adds a savory flavoring to your meal.

Directions
1.To deep-fry maifun, pour vegetable oil into pan, at least 2 inches deep; heat to 400 degrees F. Add maifun, a little at a time. When maifun comes to top of oil, remove. Drain briefly on paper towel.
2. Use in salads or as a bed for stir-fry combinations. To soften maifun, cover with hot water; let stand 10 minutes. Drain well. Coarsely chop, if desired. Add to soups, stews, stir-fry combinations or salads, as desired.
title: Dynasty Maifun Rice Sticks 6.75 oz
